definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)

sentences.english: I walk into the rain curtain infatuatedly.
He put on his raincoat and soon disappeared in the rain.
sentences.chinese: 他穿上雨衣，很快便消失在雨幕中。

sentences.english: Just a step beyond the rain.
sentences.chinese: 就只在雨幕後的一步之遙。

sentences.english: The grey rain-curtain of this world rolls back, and all turns to silver glass, and then you see it.
sentences.chinese: 當人世間的灰色雨幕拉開，所見將是一片銀白透明。

sentences.english: The yearning tears are the deep rain and curtain.
sentences.chinese: 熱望的淚是深深的雨幕。

sentences.english: The whole landscape becomes misty and glittering in the rain curtain covering the sky.
sentences.chinese: 山山水水，朦朧在漫天的雨幕中閃動。

sentences.english: I asked, squinting through the rain.
sentences.chinese: 我問道，眯着眼透過雨幕看去。

sentences.english: Rain, a group of heavily armed soldiers to 18 divisions command stealth.
sentences.chinese: 雨幕中，一隊全副武裝的士兵向十八師團司令部潛行。

definition: fine rain/drizzle/poem by Tang poet Li Shangyin 李商隱|李商隐
